DOC.brief_summary: Patency duration of covered metal stents as compared with uncovered metal stents in the management of malignant strictures of the extra-hepatic biliary tree.
DOC.brief_title: Covered Versus Uncovered Biliary Stents for Biliary Malignancies
DOC.detailed_description: Consecutive patients with malignant strictures of the extra-hepatic biliary tree considered unfit for surgical excision Placement of covered or uncovered metal stents in patients with and without gallbladder on the basis of a computer-generated randomization list Evaluation of clinical outcome, survival, complications, and quality of life. Evaluation of the cost and efficacy of the two types of metal stents.
DOC.criteria: adult patients with symptomatic malignant obstruction of the extrahepatic biliary tree not eligible for surgical intervention able to provide informed consent benign biliary obstruction previous surgery of the biliary tract life expectancy < 3 months
DOC.keyword: distal malignancy of the extra-hepatic biliary tract
